action->Crystal Burst.name: Kristallexplosion
action->Crystal Burst.description: Eine Explosion rasiermesserscharfer Splitter fügt in einer @Template[burst|distance:30]{Explosion von 30 Fuß/9 m} innerhalb von 120 Fuß/36 m @Damage[15d6[piercing]|traits:item:frequency:limited]{15W6 Stichschaden} zu (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic]{einfacher Reflexwurf}). Der Grufthüter kann Kristallexplosion [[/br 1d4 #Runden]]{1W4 Runden} lang nicht einsetzen.

action->Slashing Surge.name: Klauensturm
action->Slashing Surge.description: Der Grufthüter nutzt eine Bewegung zum Laufen oder Klettern und führt während dieser Bewegung zwei Klauenangriffe aus. Jeder Angriff muss auf eine andere Kreatur gerichtet sein. Der Malus für Mehrfachangriffe erhöht sich erst nach beiden Angriffen.

Vegetable Lamb.name: Vegetable Lamb
Vegetable Lamb.publicNotes:
Vegetable lambs are gaining popularity as the first elemental to be summoned by spellcasters in training, as they're docile until provoked and easy to control. Casters must take care, however, to not let them germinate in the Universe; they're a highly invasive species that can devour an entire forest within a decade.

The healing and nourishing food that grows from vegetable lambs is appealing for adventurers and sedentary magical scholars alike. The taste is similar to the plants of the same kind that grow on Golarion, but not entirely. Many have noted that there's a slight similarity to meat—a bit of umami one wouldn't find in an ordinary flower.

action->Nature's Bounty.name: Nature's Bounty
action->Nature's Bounty.description: Each day, a vegetable lamb grows [[/r 1d4 #Edible Flowers]] edible flowers (such as artichoke, broccoli, or dandelion) among the green cotton covering its body. These vegetables can be picked without hurting the lamb. A living creature can eat the vegetable with an Interact action to regain @Damage[(1d6+4)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Cottonseed Burst.name: Cottonseed Burst
action->Cottonseed Burst.description: The vegetable lamb releases a cloud of cottony green pollen in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on itself. All creatures caught in the burst that need to breathe, apart from the lamb, must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} by coughing (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} on a critical failure).

Veiled Current.name: Veiled Current
Veiled Current.publicNotes:
Often considered cousins of phades, veiled currents are loose veils of wind who catch prey within their folds.

Many elementals that roam the Plane of Air embody the mercurial formlessness and chaos of tumultuous storms.

Tempestuous Spirits

Air elementals are often flighty contrarians, often more concerned with bringing about change than with the specific changes they enact. Art and writing created by such elementals is exceptionally rare, as they usually destroy their projects once the challenge and excitement of completing them fades.

Invisible Courtiers

Formless and invisible elementals are the favored children of Hshurha, the air elementals' mother goddess. They receive favorable treatment in her realm, Verglas Precessional, where they serve as trusted advisors, emissaries to other planes, and members of her personal retinue, in addition to performing clandestine tasks the goddess wishes to keep hidden.

action->Naturally Invisible.name: Naturally Invisible
action->Naturally Invisible.description: The veiled current is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} at all times. When they take a hostile action of any kind, the veiled current is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} instead of undetected as the vague outline of their humanoid form becomes faintly visible until the start of their next turn.

action->Envelop.name: Envelop
action->Envelop.description:
Requirements The veiled current begins their turn with a target of their size or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The veiled current maintains the Grab and coalesces around the creature, stretching themself into a semisolid veil that smothers the creature within. This thereafter has the same effect as if the veiled current had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} the creature (DC 26, 1d8+8 bludgeoning, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 26, Rupture 17). As engulfing a creature is a hostile action, the veiled current is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} instead of undetected every round it has a creature engulfed.

Veldenar.name: Veldenar
Veldenar.publicNotes:
Some dangers lurking within the Endless Sky can doom prey before they even realize it; such are the ambush tactics of the 20-foot-tall elementals known as veldenars. Their inherent invisibility and pale, almost translucent forms make them among the most deadly creatures to call the Plane of Air home.

Veldenars resemble amphibians from the Universe, albeit with myriad red eyes and an affinity for cold. Hunting along the edges of eternal storms, the event horizons of dead zones, and the banks of sky streams, veldenars prey on the lesser denizens of their home plane. They can often be found using their natural buoyancy to drift among the large chunks of magical ice that crossed onto the Plane of Air from its former border with the Plane of Water. There, they extend their tongues to trap unwary flying insects or adventurers who might happen to float by. Their multiple eyes keep watch for their next meal even while devouring current prey.

The intense cold of a veldenar's stomach rapidly incapacitates its victims, allowing the predator to focus on returning to invisibility and finding a secluded spot to digest. Victims who escape the veldenar's stomach often feel chilled to the bone for days.

Veldenars aren't discerning about who or what they inhale. As a result, kinds of scrap can collect in their stomachs, especially inorganic material. Those hunting veldenars often wait until the elemental needs to regurgitate debris, as this is one of the few times a veldenar can be caught in a compromising position, unable to capture anything due to their clogged esophagus.

Paired Predators

Veldenars bond in partnership for life, which can be well over a century. Utilizing their ambush pack tactics, one veldenar will often drive potential prey into their partner's clutches. Visitors to the Plane of Air should keep in mind that if they happen to spot one veldenar, another is likely close by.

action->Natural Invisibility.name: Natural Invisibility
action->Natural Invisibility.description: A veldenar is naturally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} and only becomes visible when using a hostile action. Creatures it has engulfed remain visible within it, albeit slightly blurred by the veldenar's translucent skin.

action->Viscous Breath.name: Viscous Breath
action->Viscous Breath.description: 15 feet. The veldenar raises the viscosity of the surrounding air just by breathing it. Creatures who enter or start their turn within the emanation treat the area as difficult terrain and take a –2 status penalty to any non-magical physical attacks they attempt. This aura is suppressed whenever the veldenar has a creature engulfed.

action->Vacuum.name: Vacuum
action->Vacuum.description:
Requirements The veldenar doesn't have a creature engulfed

Effect The veldenar forcefully unlocks then expands its jaws to inhale the air in a @Template[cone|distance:15] before it, pulling Large or smaller creatures into its cavernous maw. The veldenar @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfs} the creatures in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:27], @Damage[(1d10+10)[cold]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 27, Rupture 25).

Whipping Willow.name: Whipping Willow
Whipping Willow.publicNotes: These tall, thin figures are too treelike to be dryads, yet too humanoid to be arboreals. Their blank faces and thin trunks bear only the slightest suggestion of humanoid features. Rather than hands, their long, branchlike arms eventually split into equally proportioned branchlike digits, which the willows use both to fight and swing through their native plane.

action->Grounded.name: Grounded
action->Grounded.description: When saving against an effect attempting to knock them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, a whipping willow achieves one degree of success better than what they rolled. Additionally, the willow doesn't fall prone on a critical failure to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} an opponent.

action->Constrict.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.g26YiEIfSHCpLocV]

@Damage[(2d4+5)[bludgeoning]], @Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic]

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Constrict]

action->Strangling Vines.name: Strangling Vines
action->Strangling Vines.description: When a whipping willow hits a creature with their whip Strike, they can choose to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grab} and begin strangling the creature. The target is suffocating and can't speak as long as it's strangled.

action->Unseating Sweep.name: Unseating Sweep
action->Unseating Sweep.description: The whipping willow attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} all creatures within a @Template[cone|distance:15], making a single @Check[athletics|traits:action:trip] check against all targets' Reflex DCs.

Wood Scamp.name: Wood Scamp
Wood Scamp.publicNotes:
These moss colonies coalesce over a century into the rough facsimile of a large sloth, right down to mimicking the unique structure of the animal's fur that attracts additional fungi and pollinating insects. Unless summoned or attacked, they rarely leave the trees upon which they first formed.

At first glance, wood elementals might not seem to have the same destructive potential as their cousins from the Planes of Fire, Water, or Air, but don't be fooled. The woods can be a dangerous place.

Though some resemble animals, the elemental beasts presented here are still plants, and their life cycles reflect it. Vegetable lambs grow on rooted stalks, from which they can't be removed until they've matured (or perhaps ripened), leaving them dependent on their immediate surroundings for food. Moss sloths are little more than lumps of green fluff for the first century of their existence, only gaining limited mobility once they can grow their defensive wooden claws.

Wild But Unwild

Many wood elementals are created by kizidhars and other powerful creatures on the Plane of Wood and placed in rote roles. Populating nature preserves and sprawling estates, they can be unsure how to behave if released into the wild. They're essentially born domesticated and will likely act far differently than the wild creatures they mimic, even in natural environments. Their natural predators are few, putting the elementals at less risk, although they're still sometimes eaten by giant termites or captured by some as pets.

A Brain By Any Other Name

Even if Lady Shumunue taught the wood elementals' ancestors to mimic animals, a wood elemental's consciousness is contained not in a brain but in its root system. Entities like nursery crawlers, living groves, and carved beasts use this to their advantage. That an elemental's wooden body can be carved and crafted, apparently without lasting harm, implies that they might not feel pain so long as their roots remain undamaged.

spell->Oaken Resilience (Self Only).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YWrfKetOqDwVFut7]
Oaken Resilience (Self Only)

action->Breathe Pollen.name: Breathe Pollen
action->Breathe Pollen.description: The wood scamp breathes choking pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save; creatures who don't need to breathe are immune). The wood scamp can't Breathe Pollen again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Pollen]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Thorn Puncture.name: Thorn Puncture
action->Thorn Puncture.description: The wood scamp breaks off one of its thorn-like claws in the target's skin, dealing 1 persistent bleed damage until the thorn is removed, which requires an Interact action. This damage is cumulative with each thorn caught in a creature's skin.

Wood Wisp.name: Wood Wisp
Wood Wisp.publicNotes:
Like other wisps, wood wisps roam their plane and attune to other wisps, wandering with them in symphonies. Because of their willingness to bond, wood wisps appear outside their home plane more than other wood elementals, though they're still relatively rare compared to other wisps.

Wood wisps resemble coconuts trailed by thick nests of branches that cover and conceal even deeper webs of thorny vines. They are, unfortunately, both unaware of the pain these thorns can cause fleshy creatures and very physically affectionate in their eagerness to offer assistance.

action->Accord Essence.name: Accord Essence
action->Accord Essence.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet that benefited from the wisp's resonance in the last hour is targeted by an attack

Effect The wisp detonates itself in a small elemental explosion of leaves and pollen. This gives temporary Hit Points equal to half the wisp's current HP to all allies within 30 feet that have benefited from the wisp's resonance aura in the past hour. These temporary Hit Points last 1 hour.

A wisp that uses this reaction is permanently destroyed and can be restored only by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual or similarly powerful effect. If an ability would prevent the wisp's destruction (for instance, if the wisp is summoned and would merely be dismissed), Accord Essence has no effect.

action->Resonance.name: Resonance
action->Resonance.description:
30 feet.

All wisps vibrate at a frequency attuned to their element, resonating with and empowering all creatures and effects sharing that trait. A creature in the area gains a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls for effects with the plant or wood trait; a creature with the elemental trait and either plant trait or wood trait gains this bonus to all attack and damage rolls. For wood wisps, this bonus also applies to nonmagical wooden weapons, such as staves and clubs.

action->In Concert.name: In Concert
action->In Concert.description: When a wood wisp rolls a critical failure on a check to Aid, they get a failure instead, and when they roll a success, they get a critical success instead.

Zephyr, The West Wind.name: Zephyr, der Westwind
Zephyr, The West Wind.publicNotes:
Die Wahrheit über das Leben im Universum ist, dass das Wetter die Welt kontrolliert. Das lebensspendende Wasser, das durch Golarion fließt, die Erhaltung gesunder Wälder und der Schnee, das Tauwetter und der Regen, der das Gedeihen der Pflanzen fördert, hängen alle vom Wetter ab - einem Wetter, das von den Launen der Winde bestimmt wird. Die Anemoi sind mächtige Wesen von der Ebene der Luft, die von den alten Göttern beauftragt wurden, den Himmel zu bewachen und die Winde aller Welten der Ebenen zu lenken. Sie lenken die Winde auf ihre natürlichen Bahnen, und obwohl sie weder bösartig noch böswillig sind, kümmert sich ein Anemos wenig darum, wie sich ein Sturm auf eine Kreatur auswirkt, die sich in seinem Weg befindet.

Anemoi können verschiedene Formen annehmen und zwischen ihnen so leicht wechseln, wie sie zwischen den Winden gleiten. Sie tragen humanoide Gestalten, um unter den Sterblichen zu wandeln, ohne übermäßig viel Aufmerksamkeit zu erregen und verwandeln sich in große, donnernde Pferde aus Sturmwolken und Regen, wenn sie sich schnell durch die Lüfte bewegen müssen. Ihre wahre Gestalt jedoch ist der Wind, der sich zu einer humanoiden Form zusammenzieht, oft mit lockigem Haar und gefiederten Flügeln aus weichen, treibenden Wolken.

Auf Golarion wird jeder der vier Kardinalwinde von einem Quartett von Hauptanemoi erzeugt und gelenkt. Die kalten Nordwinde werden von Boreal, dem Bringer des Winters, geleitet. Austral hütet die heißen Winde aus dem Süden. Eural bringt die stürmischen Winde aus dem Osten. Die sanften Frühlingswinde schließlich kommen auf den Ruf von Zephyr aus dem Westen. Diese vier Hauptanemoi und ihre Räte der geringeren Anemoi formen und kontrollieren die Winde auf ganz Golarion. Soweit man weiß, unterstehen die Hauptanemoi keiner höheren Autorität. Es gibt sogar noch mächtigere maximale Anemoi, die auf der Ebene der Luft leben, welche sich aber damit zufrieden zu geben scheinen, das Universum aus ihren Plänen herauszuhalten.

Obwohl die Hauptsnemoi versuchen, sich von den Angelegenheiten der Sterblichen fernzuhalten, interessieren sich die weniger mächtigen Anemoi gelegentlich stärker dafür. Einige überwachen eine einzelne Siedlung oder einen Bezirk, beschützen, ernähren oder zerstören sie sogar aus Rachsucht. Jeder von ihnen hat seine eigenen Interessen. Viele sind eitel oder kleinlich. Noch mehr ändern ihre Einstellung so schnell wie die Winde, die sie lenken. Einem Anemoi zu gefallen, bedeutet nicht, einer festen Formel zu folgen, sondern immer wieder den Kurs zu ändern, um ihm das zu geben, was er sich für seine momentanen Interessen oder vermeintlichen Bedürfnisse wünscht.

Die Gestalt des Windes

Anemoi auf der Ebene der Luft sind in der Regel geschlechtslos, während diejenigen, die sich im Universum aufhalten, manchmal mit einem der Geschlechter der Sterblichen, die sie beobachten oder in deren Nähe sie leben, experimentieren oder Vorlieben dafür entwickeln.

action->Truespeech.name: Wahre Sprache
action->Truespeech.description: Ein Anemos kann mit jeder Kreatur sprechen und sie verstehen, solange sie sprechen kann.

action->Wind Orchestra.name: Windorchester
action->Wind Orchestra.description: Ein Anemos benötigt keine Instrumente, um Musik zu spielen, sondern nutzt seine Winde, um die Klänge aller Instrumente, die er nachahmen möchte, zu erzeugen und zu übertragen. Sie können eine beliebige Anzahl von Instrumenten gleichzeitig nachahmen und so ihr eigenes persönliches Orchester schaffen und dirigieren.

action->Blessed by the Winds.name: Von den Winden gesegnet
action->Blessed by the Winds.description: 80 Fuß/24 m. Die Winde werden turbulent für diejenigen, die es wagen, im selben Gebiet wie ein Anemos zu fliegen, sie achten aber darauf, ihren Hirten nicht zu verletzen oder zu belästigen. Die Luft innerhalb der Ausstrahlung ist für fliegende Kreaturen, die nicht über die Eigenschaft Luft verfügen, schwer zu erreichen. Solange die Aura aktiv ist, können Anemoi nicht von der Umgebungsluft oder dem Wetter beeinflusst werden, es sei denn, sie wollen es.

action->Earthbane.name: Erdverderben
action->Earthbane.description: Die Regeneration von Anemoi wird für 1 Runde unterdrückt, wenn sie von einem Erdeffekt betroffen werden, oder so lange wie sie mit dem Erdboden Kontakt haben plus eine Runde danach. Wenn ein Anemos von mindestens 2,50 cm Schlamm, Dreck oder Stein begraben ist, wird dessen Aura deaktiviert und der Anemos erhält die Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt 2} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 2}.

action->Redirect Weather.name: Wetter umlenken
action->Redirect Weather.description:
Voraussetzungen Die Aura des Anemos ist aktiv

Auslöser Eine Kreatur in der Aura des Anemos nutzt einen Luft- oder Elektrizitätszauber oder ein Luft- oder Elektrizitätszauber wird auf andere Art und Weise in der Aura aktiviert

Effekt Die Winde und das Wetter des Zaubers gehorchen dem Ruf des Anemos. Der Anemos trifft alle Entscheidungen, um die Ziele, den Bestimmungsort oder andere Effekte des Zaubers zu bestimmen, als wäre er der Zauberwirkende.

action->Collect Thunder.name: Donner sammeln
action->Collect Thunder.description:
Voraussetzungen Der Anemos hat eine freie Hand

Effekt Der Anemos fährt mit einer Hand durch die Winde, die um ihn herumwirbeln, die Funken an seinen Fingerspitzen vereinen sich zu einem Blitz. Der Anemos erschafft einen Blitz in seiner offenen Hand. Wenn der Anemos eine Aktion ausgibt, um Donner zu sammeln, schlägt stattdessen ein Donnerblitz in seine offene Hand ein und erzeugt ein dröhnendes Geläut, das alle Kreaturen im Umkreis von 20 Fuß/6 m eine Runde lang @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Taub} macht, es sei denn, sie schaffen einen @Check[fortitude|dc:40]{Zähigkeitswurf}. Alle Blitze lösen sich nach 1 Runde auf.

action->Command the Breeze.name: Brise befehligen
action->Command the Breeze.description: Wenn ein Anemos ein Ritual wirkt, führt er alle Aspekte des Rituals selbst aus und befiehlt seinen Winden, alle Komponenten des Rituals zu vervollständigen. Sie müssen alle Anforderungen für die zusätzlichen Zauberwirker des Rituals erfüllen und müssen die Würfe ablegen, die normalerweise von zusätzlichen Zauberwirkern abgelegt werden. Darüber hinaus können Anemoi Rituale schneller als üblich wirken. Wenn ein Ritual eine Wirkzeit in Tagen hat, können sie es in der gleichen Anzahl von Stunden wirken.

action->Storm Strikes Twice.name: Der Blitz schlägt zweimal ein
action->Storm Strikes Twice.description: Der Anemos wirft einen Blitzschlag und wird dann zu einem Wind, der ihn in einem Augenblick zum Ort des Blitzes trägt, um erneut anzugreifen. Er führt einen Fernkampf-Blitzschlag gegen eine Kreatur innerhalb seiner ersten Reichweite aus, teleportiert sich als Windstoß an den Ort der Kreatur, ergreift dann den geworfenen Blitz und führt einen Nahkampf-Blitzschlag gegen eine Kreatur in Reichweite aus. Der Malus für Mehrfachangriffe erhöht sich erst, wenn beide Angriffe ausgeführt wurden.

action->Swiftness.name: Schnelligkeit
action->Swiftness.description: Die Bewegungen eines Anemos lösen keine Reaktionen aus.

Zuhra.name: Zuhra
Zuhra.publicNotes:
Zuhras, the genies of the elemental Plane of Metal, are bold and imposing, fond of being the center of attention and drawing a crowd with flashy performances, displays of skill, and tales of their personal victories. Despite their large personalities, their long-term relationships tend to be cool and somewhat distant; zuhras often make alliances but rarely form friendships, and the trust required for deeper relationships is rarer still. The few mortals who've gotten to know a zuhra often describe them as bombastic but emotionally aloof.

Since the reconnection with other planes, zuhras have sought out and formed bonds with other genies. They find their jabali cousins to be capable smithing partners, if a bit staid and dull. Zuhras rarely pay non-genie elementals any more than a passing glance, finding even the intelligent ones uninteresting to communicate with or hard to relate to.

spell->Interplanar Teleport (At Will) (T.name: Interplanar Teleport (At Will) (To Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or Universe only)
spell->Interplanar Teleport (At Will) (T.description:
Requirements You have a planar key for the destination plane, used as a locus

You and your allies traverse the barriers between planes of existence. The targets move to another plane, such as the Plane of Fire, the Netherworld, or the Outer Rifts. You must know the destination plane exists and use a magic planar key created from material from that plane as a locus for the spell. While the planar keys for most prominent planes are uncommon, just like the spell interplanar teleport, more obscure planes and demiplanes often have rare or possibly even unique planar keys.

The spell is highly imprecise, and you appear 1d20×25 miles from the last place one of the targets (of your choice) was located the last time that target traveled to the plane. If it's the first time traveling to a particular plane for all targets, you appear at a random location on the plane. Interplanar teleport doesn't provide a means of return travel, though casting interplanar teleport again allows you to return to your previous plane unless there are extenuating circumstances.

action->Conductive Redirection.name: Conductive Redirection
action->Conductive Redirection.description:
Trigger The zuhra is hit by an attack, spell, or effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The zuhra conducts the electricity through their body, taking damage as normal, and redirecting a bolt at one target within 30 feet that they can see. The zuhra makes a ranged attack roll with a [[/r 1d20+20 #Conductive Redirection]]{+20} modifier against the target's AC. On a hit or critical hit, the target takes electricity damage equal to the full damage of the triggering effect.

action->Blinding Reflection.name: Blinding Reflection
action->Blinding Reflection.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The zuhra is in dim or bright light

Effect The zuhra briefly reshapes part of their metallic body into a concave surface to reflect the surrounding light into the eyes of a creature within 30 feet. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26] save. It's then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the start of the zuhra's next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the start of the zuhra's next turn.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

The zuhra transforms into a Small or Medium metal elemental or animal. This doesn't affect the zuhra's statistics, but it could change the damage type of their Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Zuhra Shuyookh.name: Zuhra Shuyookh
Zuhra Shuyookh.publicNotes:
The most powerful zuhras draw followers and elemental metal with overwhelming force of personality and literal magnetism. When called upon to conduct wish rituals, they use their long isolation from the other planes as an excuse to misinterpret requests outlandishly, claiming linguistic differences.

On a hit or critical hit, the target takes electricity damage equal to the full damage of the triggering effect.

action->Magnetic Field.name: Magnetic Field
action->Magnetic Field.description:
10 feet.

All squares in the aura are difficult terrain for creatures wearing metal armor or made of metal. Strikes with metallic weapons made by or against creatures in this aura take a –2 status penalty to the attack roll. Zuhras ignore these effects.

action->Magnetic Reposition.name: Magnetic Reposition
action->Magnetic Reposition.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The shuyookh targets any number of creatures affected by their magnetic field, and moves each target 10 feet in a direction the zuhra chooses. Each target can resist being moved if it succeeds at a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save.

action->Magnetic Storm.name: Magnetic Storm
action->Magnetic Storm.description:
Requirements The shuyookh's magnetic field is active

Effect The shuyookh electromagnetically flings razor-sharp metal scraps. Each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] takes @Damage[8d6[slashing],3d12[electricity]] damage, with a @Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save.

The shuyookh's magnetic field is deactivated for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Mercurial Wish.name: Mercurial Wish
action->Mercurial Wish.description:
Frequency three times per year

Effect The shuyookh conducts a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} ritual for the benefit of a mortal, requiring no cost or secondary casters. The shuyookh's result is a success if they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] or a failure if not. The shuyookh attempts to fulfill the wish in a way that creates an unstable or impermanent benefit.
